intro: Octomeria stellaris, commonly known as the star octomeris, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found growing in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
